snippet: One of the richest counties in America risks running out of money next month, in what one official called “the worst fiscal crisis in the history of the county.”
abstract: Suffolk County executive Steven Bellone declares financial emergency after receiving a report on the county's finances by an outside panel of experts that shows a completely unexpected deficit; declaration gives Suffolk the power to withhold 10 percent of money allotted to each department of government, but does not require the establishment of a fiscal control board; Bellone says he will leave it to others to determine whether anyone had falsified county records to hide the deficit now coming into view.
lead_paragraph: One of the richest counties in America risks running out of money next month, in what one official called “the worst fiscal crisis in the history of the county.”

headline.seo: Suffolk County Executive Declares a Financial Emergency
headline.main: Suffolk County Cites Emergency in Finances
